properties.value:
learn the basics of what linguistics is
basic subfields and topics in linguistics, short introduction to each one
ability to identify difference between linguistics and other fields like learning languages, psychology, philosophy...

checklist.label: Understand the basic concept of AI, its main components, and everyday examples.
Discuss ethical implications of AI, including issues of privacy, bias, and decision-making.
Understand the concept of bias in AI and its societal implications.
Understand the collaboration between human creativity and AI algorithms.
Recognize the importance of digital privacy and the role of AI in data collection.
Understand the basics of safe online behavior in AI-integrated platforms.
Evaluate the reliability of AI-driven content (e.g., deepfakes, automated articles, hallucinations).

properties.req: activity should include students using computers but not using ai itself. there shuold be groupwork and a component where they share their learnings with the class.
a debate about a topic in the intersection of ai literacy and linguistics
